item.title: 3.3 Examples
item.description:
3.3 Exponential Derivatives: Examples

Ex1.

Differentiate \( f(x) = e^{3x} \)

Solution: The derivative of \( e^u \) with respect to \( x \) is \( e^u \cdot u' \), where \( u = 3x \).

  1. Differentiate \( u(x) = 3x \):
    \( u'(x) = 3 \) Now apply the chain rule: \[ f'(x) = e^{3x} \cdot 3 \] Thus, the derivative is: \[ f'(x) = 3e^{3x} \]

3.3 Derivatives of Exponential Functions

Ex1.

Differentiate the following function:

\[ f(x) = e^{2x} \]
Solution Using the chain rule: \[ \frac{d}{dx}[e^u] = e^u \cdot u' \]

Let \( u = 2x \). Then \( u' = 2 \).

  1. Apply the chain rule: \[ f'(x) = e^{2x} \cdot 2 \]
  2. Final derivative: \[ f'(x) = 2e^{2x} \]
